title: How to Make Model Horse Tied Halters

steps.headline: Wrap the string (or whatever you wish to use) around the model horse's nose.
Double knot it.
Bring one of the strings around the horse's head near the ears.
Tie it to the other side.
Cut off one side.
Take the side you cut off and tie it where the cheek is.
Wrap it under the cheek (not over it).
Tie it.
Fold the ribbon around a jump ring so that about a centimeter is on the other side.
With the ribbon still at its full length, measure it so that it reaches the other side of the horse's mouth.
steps.description: Cut it a little longer than that. Sew the end around another jump ring. You should now have a strip of ribbon with a jump ring on each side.

steps.headline: Sew another piece of ribbon to one of the jump rings.
Hold the jump rings around you horse's mouth, so that each one is on one cheek with the ribbon on the top.
steps.description: With the other piece or ribbon that is sewn to one side of the jump ring, measure so that is halfway under the horse's chin. Cut the ribbon and sew to a jump ring.

steps.headline: Sew a piece of ribbon to each of the jump rings to form a circle around your horse's nose.
Once this has been completed, sew a piece of ribbon to a jump ring.
steps.description: Measure the back of the horse's head so that the jump ring is underneath his head. Sew another piece of ribbon to the other side. Measure the ribbon so that it comes to the middle of the horse's head and cut on both sides. Then sew a jump ring on each side.

steps.headline: Sew a ribbon to one of the jump rings.
steps.description: Measure it so that the ribbon is on the top of the horse's head. Cut and sew a small buckle or jump ring to it.

steps.headline: With the other jump ring, sew a piece of ribbon to it.
steps.description: Make sure that it can reach the buckle and cut. Fold the end over and sew it, so that it does not fray.

steps.headline: Go back to the nose band.
steps.description: Sew one piece of ribbon to each jump ring so they all face the same way.

steps.headline: Finally, measure the length of your horse's head.
steps.description: Sew each of the ribbons from the nose band to three jump rings on the head piece. Now you have an adjustable halter to fit your model horse.

steps.headline: Make a slip-knot in a piece string or whatever other item you are using for a halter.
See if the slip-knot fits the horse's head.
steps.description: The biggest part should go behind the ears, and the small loop should go around the nose.

steps.headline: If it doesn't fit, simply loosen or tighten the loops by pulling the 2 strings.
Now it fits.
steps.description: Slip it on, and cut off the loose strings. If you want a halter with a lead rope, only cut off one end.

text: Basic halter Wrap the string (or whatever you wish to use) around the model horse's nose.  Double knot it.  Bring one of the strings around the horse's head near the ears.  Tie it to the other side.  Cut off one side.  Take the side you cut off and tie it where the cheek is.  Wrap it under the cheek (not over it).  Tie it. You are done! Advanced halter Fold the ribbon around a jump ring so that about a centimeter is on the other side. Glue or sew it down. With the ribbon still at its full length, measure it so that it reaches the other side of the horse's mouth. Cut it a little longer than that. Sew the end around another jump ring. You should now have a strip of ribbon with a jump ring on each side. Sew another piece of ribbon to one of the jump rings.  Hold the jump rings around you horse's mouth, so that each one is on one cheek with the ribbon on the top. With the other piece or ribbon that is sewn to one side of the jump ring, measure so that is halfway under the horse's chin. Cut the ribbon and sew to a jump ring. Sew a piece of ribbon to each of the jump rings to form a circle around your horse's nose. Put to one side. Once this has been completed, sew a piece of ribbon to a jump ring. Measure the back of the horse's head so that the jump ring is underneath his head. Sew another piece of ribbon to the other side. Measure the ribbon so that it comes to the middle of the horse's head and cut on both sides. Then sew a jump ring on each side. Sew a ribbon to one of the jump rings. Measure it so that the ribbon is on the top of the horse's head. Cut and sew a small buckle or jump ring to it. With the other jump ring, sew a piece of ribbon to it. Make sure that it can reach the buckle and cut. Fold the end over and sew it, so that it does not fray. Go back to the nose band. Sew one piece of ribbon to each jump ring so they all face the same way. Finally, measure the length of your horse's head. Sew each of the ribbons from the nose band to three jump rings on the head piece. Now you have an adjustable halter to fit your model horse. Slip-knot halter Make a slip-knot in a piece string or whatever other item you are using for a halter.  See if the slip-knot fits the horse's head. The biggest part should go behind the ears, and the small loop should go around the nose. If it doesn't fit, simply loosen or tighten the loops by pulling the 2 strings.  Now it fits. Slip it on, and cut off the loose strings. If you want a halter with a lead rope, only cut off one end.
